programme.title: Enfusion Reality Season 1, episode 10
programme.desc: Drago has a ball ride with a dramatic ending. The Armenian is barely fit for fight with Pasi from Finland.

programme.title: Legend FC #2
programme.desc: Legend Fighting Championship (Legend) was the Asia-Pacific championship of Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). Legend invited national champion MMA fighters from throughout the Asia-Pacific region to compete in a freestyle tournament using interdisciplinary martial arts skills in supervised matches under a strict set of rules designed to promote athlete safety and sportsmanship. Legend was committed to promoting the sport of MMA throughout the region, to supporting and cultivating its athletes, and to providing exceptional entertainment to a broad audience.

programme.title: Uncommon Courtesy
programme.desc: Many believe the Edwardian society was a rigid system of empty gestures and rituals and was just too restrictive in the lives of people. Well, the Edwardians didn’t quite see it that way. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder takes a fascinating look at how...

programme.title: Memories from the Big Movie Part 1
programme.desc: Ken Marschall take us behind the scenes for a remarkable look at the making of James Cameron’s Titanic. If you’ve ever wondered how they built the ship and everything around it to look so real, this is an episode you can’t miss.

programme.title: A Very Different World
programme.desc: Charles takes us back to 1912 and gives historic insight into how people received the Titanic news. He also makes the case that Titanic may have changed the world of journalism forever.

programme.title: Masabumi Hosono
programme.desc: The only Japanese passenger on Titanic helped save lives, but was ostracized back in his home country for the rest of his life. There’s been many published accounts about Hosono, but now Robert Bracken gives us the real story.

programme.title: The Captain's Table
programme.desc: First class trans-Atlantic travel is synonymous with fine dining. For the select few, the ultimate dining experience is to be invited to the Captain’s table. Sauder takes us back in time and gives us a seat at Captain Smith’s table.

programme.title: Did First Officer Murdoch Shoot Himself?
programme.desc: Did First Officer Murdoch Shoot Himself? The Cameron movie suggests he did, but Parks Stephenson provides us with an eyewitness testimony that states another end for Officer Murdoch.

programme.title: A Thief on Titanic
programme.desc: It’s always been a mystery why so many passengers on board Titanic were traveling incognito. Senan Molony uncovers the identity of one secret traveler, who ended up being a thief.

programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero!

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: Expansion Joints
programme.desc: Harland & Wolff decided to fit expansion joints into Olympic’s superstructure to protect the ships deck houses. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside tells us how they worked and why they were needed.

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Titanic's Morse Lamps
programme.desc: Before radio, ships had to communicate with each other visually. During the day they used hand flags and at night it was through morse lamps. Bill Sauder explains Titanic’s Lamps: where they were located and how they were used.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 1
programme.desc: Shipwreck explorer, Richie Kohler takes us without a submersible to the warm blue waters of the Aegean Sea and the remarkably preserved HMHS Britannic. Kohler reveals what it’s like to swim freely through the passageways of one of the largest...

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: The Big Four
programme.desc: Celtic, Cedric, Baltic, and Adriatic proceeded the design of Olympic, Titanic, and Britannic. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals why in many ways, they were perhaps the most successful quartet of ships ever built for North Atlantic service.

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Forward A Deck Promenade
programme.desc: It’s always been suggested that H&W decided to enclose the forward end of Titanic’s A deck promenade because Olympic’s first-class passengers had complained about sea spray. Mark Chirnside believes that might not be the reason and he explains why.

programme.title: Was Olympic Retired Too Soon?
programme.desc: Olympic was taken out of service in 1935, after nearly a quarter of a century of a very successful career. Was she retired too soon? It certainly seems there was still plenty of life in her. Mark Chirnside looks at the reasons she was scrapped and why...

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Inquiries and More
programme.desc: In part two of his series on lost documents, Charles Haas looks at other significant collections of Titanic documents that have simply disappeared in one way or another over the years.

programme.title: The Untold Story of the Titanic Deck Chair
programme.desc: The Titanic story goes out in so many different directions and this is one of them! A Titanic deck chair, recovered by the Mackay-Bennett and later auctioned, provides us with a new Titanic Story that you might not have heard before from Craig Sopin!

programme.title: Vendée Globe 2024 - Mag #11 (Eng)
programme.desc: Charlie Dalin wins the Vendée Globe ahead of Yoann Richomme and Sébastien Simon in record time. the battle still rages for fourth place between Jérémie Beyou and Sam Goodchild. Jean-Luc Nélias, team manager of Macif Santé Prévoyance, analyzes Charlie Dalins victory.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2023 New Zealand
programme.desc: Opening up the 2023 GWA season, the Tip Top GWA Wingfoil World Cup, presented by Armstrong Foils, is the first the GWA event in New Zealand or the Pacific. Featuring both the Surf-Slalom and Surf-Freestyle disciplines, this first world cup event of the season will be held at Mount Maunganui Main Beach over 6 days of an 8 day window, 3rd-11th March. Over this event period in early March there are to expect wind strengths of 10-18 knots each day in the afternoons with the sea breezes further building up to 15-25 knots.

programme.title: Qatar Airways GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2023 - Germany
programme.desc: The mid-point stop of the kite-surf discipline on the Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour lands in Sylt, Germany. It comes shortly after the conclusion of the event at Rio de Janeiro’s Saquarema surf break. The rugged North Sea coastline of Sylt will provide a vastly different stage, presenting unique challenges that will likely be very distinct from the tropical setting of Rio.

programme.title: Norvan Falls
programme.desc: A group of us pay a visit to one of our favourite local waterfalls, Norvan Falls in North Vancouver, BC. Youll also get a look at how the falls look when frozen mid-winter.

programme.title: FWT Junior World Championship 2024
programme.desc: The FWT Junior World Championship (FWT JWC) is the highlight of the freeride juniors on ski and snowboard. On January 20th to 26th 2023, the annual highlight of the season takes place in Kappl-Paznaun, Austria. In challenging runs, the junior athletes show spectacular jumps and drops in the terrain as well as challenging lines through the deep snow.

programme.title: Engadin Ski Marathon 2023
programme.desc: On Sunday, March 12, 2023, more than 14,000 athletes competed in the 53rd edition of the Engadin Skimarathon, the second largest cross-country skiing event in the world and the largest cross-country skiing event in Switzerland. Among the large crowd of participants are also world-class runners. What awaits them on this day in the high valley are 42 strenuous kilometers over frozen lakes, past typical Engadine villages and through a picturesque Swiss Alpine landscape. The best completed the course in a time of around 1.5 hours.

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2025
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe. This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers.

programme.title: Expedition Antarctica of extreme sports woman Caro North
programme.desc: Iceclimbing, ski mountaineering and sailing the open water for days through the infamous Drake Passage: The 28 years old extreme sports woman Caro North made her way to the very South of our continent for a four weeks expedition – accompanied by an eight-member crew. Antarctica turned out to be a paradise for extreme sports: deserted landscapes and snow-capped mountains against a surreal backdrop of ice and sea were waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: Ötztaler Radmarathon 2023
programme.desc: The Ötztaler myth. Every year, around 4,000 racing cyclists have a dream: to finish the most demanding cycling marathon in the Alps. The circuit leads on 227 kilometers from Sölden over 4 alpine passes (Kühtaisattel, Brenner-, Jaufenpass and Timmelsjoch) to South Tyrol and back again. The participants master an unbelievable 5,500 meters of altitude, the fastest among them reaching the finish line in a record time of just over seven hours.Le mythe de lÖtztal. Chaque année, environ 4 000 coureurs cyclistes ont un rêve : terminer le marathon cycliste le plus exigeant des Alpes. Le circuit mène sur 227 kilomètres de Sölden par 4 cols alpins (Kühtaisattel, Brenner-, Jaufenpass et Timmelsjoch) au Tyrol du Sud et retour. Les participants maîtrisent un dénivelé incroyable de 5 500 mètres, les plus rapides dentre eux atteignant la ligne darrivée en un temps record dun peu plus de sept heures.

programme.title: Swiss Epic 2023
programme.desc: Teams of two compete in Switzerland’s pictures Graubünden region for the overall victory and important UCI mountain bike points at the Swiss Epic. With more than 350km and almost 12,000 meters of altitude, everything is demanded from the best mountain bikers. The route of the SPAR Swiss Epic 2023 leads over the breathtaking trails of Graubünden and crosses the Alps from Lenzerheide to St. Moritz before the event reaches its traditional conclusion in the town of Davos.

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2024
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe.This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers. Fans from across the globe have the opportunity to witness the future of freeskiing unfold in real-time.

programme.title: Julbo White Session Zermatt & Chamonix
programme.desc: The unique story of two skiing legends (Sam Anthamatten and Vivian Bruchez) who invite a passionate amateur, Philip Criveli, to climb and ride the north face of the Breithorn (in Zermatt) as well as the Passerelle and Aiguillettes couloirs (in Chamonix).

programme.title: La Grande Odyssée 2023 - Best of
programme.desc: The Grande Odyssée VVF, carrying the fundamental values ​​of those who love the mountains, has been since its first edition in January 2005, an essential event for dog sledding in Europe. For the first time in 19 years, the Grande Odyssée VVF will cover, in addition to Savoie and Haute Savoie, the department of Isère. The 19th edition will be held from January 7 to 19, 2023, with the presence of 66 mushers and their 600 top-level athletic dogs from all over Europe. They will set off for 13 days of racing, 400 km, 12,000 m of elevation gain, 11 stages, and will cross around 20 ski resorts.

programme.title: Aussie 8
programme.desc: Aussie 8 is the adventure of 3 friends who decided to climb the 8 tallest mountains in 8 Australian states in 8 days. To make this possible, they had to put together and respect a very strict timing and logistic organisation.

programme.title: La Grande Odyssée 2024 - Best Of
programme.desc: The Grande Odyssée VVF has been, since its first edition in January 2005, the annual sled dog event in Europe. It is the most demanding stage race in a unique alpine setting in the world. This year 2024, an exceptional sporting field is brought together with more than 65 international mushers and their 600 very high-level dog-athletes who will compete over nearly 400km and 12,000m of cumulative positive altitude difference, in the superb landscapes of the French region Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes.

programme.title: Highest Peak on Vancouver's North Shore - BRUNSWICK MOUNTAIN (Eng)
programme.desc: We summit Brunswick Mountain, the highest peak on Vancouvers North Shore, followed by Mt. Harvey right next to it. This video was filmed on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples - Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), Tsleil-Waututh & Musqueam First Nations.

programme.title: A Feather in the West
programme.desc: In September 2019, a team of talented Irish climbers [Chloe Condron, Kevin Kilroy, Michelle OLoughlin and Conor McGovern] travelled to the small island of Owey to explore sea cliffs that local guidebook writer Iain Miller claims, have “enough new routing potential to last at least twelve lifetimes”. ‘A Feather in the West’ is a film about their trad climbing experiences and the relatively niche pursuit of first ascents, set on the Wild Atlantic Way, off the west coast of County Donegal. (Special thanks to Pertex)

programme.title: EdgeWater 262 CX – Versatility and Performance at the 2024 St. Petersburg Boat Show
programme.desc: The EdgeWater 262 CX, a solid and versatile center console, ideal for fishing, relaxation and family excursions, makes its debut at St. Petersburg 2024.

programme.title: To be one with the sea
programme.desc: Discover an incredibly enjoyable walkaround, the Fiart 35 Seawalker. Designed by the shipyard’s technical department, led by Massimo Simioni, this warcraft has been conceived to enjoy the pleasing sensation of being one with the sea.

programme.title: Pirelli 35 WA - An exceptional rib
programme.desc: The Pirelli 35 WA by TecnoRib is a walkaround with aerodynamic lines and a contemporary and gritty look. The aesthetics are cured and the performances are not any less worthy.

programme.title: Nimbus T8 – Compact, powerful, fun
programme.desc: Nimbus T8 is a sporty and versatile tender, designed for comfort and handling. It is equipped with Simrad NSX by Navico Group, a cutting-edge navigation system for an intuitive and safe driving experience.

programme.title: Genova Boat Show 2022 - Inflatable boats
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono is at the Genova Boat Show to present you some of the news inflatable boats at the event. Amongst them: Tecnorib P50, Ranieri International Cayman 45 Cruiser, Zar Formenti 95 Sport Luxury and Marco R26.

programme.title: Suncoast Boat Show (Eng)
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Suncoast Boat Show, a must-see event for boating enthusiasts and industry professionals, and Bill Hackett provides a detailed overview of the boats on display.

programme.title: 500 Offshore – A striking tender
programme.desc: Maurizio Bulleri is on board the 500 Offshore, a tender inspired by the iconic Fiat 500.

programme.title: Seakeeper 2 - on board Beneteau Flyer 9
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono is on board the Beneteau Flyer 9 to explain the functioning of the Seakeeper 2, a system that aims to reduce the onboard rolling up to 95.

programme.title: Rimorchiatori riuniti (Eng)
programme.desc: Hop on board the new tugboat of Rimorchiatori Riuniti for an exclusive test out in the water of Genoa. Captain Gianluca Zappia leads this operation.

programme.title: Genova Boat Show 2021 - Motor
programme.desc: Our Maurizio Bulleri is in Genova with the crew of The Boat Show for a special nautical appointment: the Genova Boat Show. What does this edition have in store for us? Discover all the news from the motor world.

programme.title: Hall of fame - Mitja Gialutz
programme.desc: The Boat Show invites Mitja Gialuz, President of Società Velica Barcola, organizer of the famous Barcolana regatta. Discover this exclusive interview.

programme.title: Felci Yacht Design
programme.desc: The Boat Show interviews for you the architect Umberto Felci, one of the most important designers of sailing yachts, founder with the engineer Lorenzo Giovannozzi of Felci Yacht Design, a design and engineering company in the most diverse areas of sailing boats.

programme.title: Sea Doo Switch - MIBS 2024
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese and Bill Hackett present a walkthrough of the Sea-Doo pontoon boat at the 2024 Miami International Boat Show, capable of over 100 mph on just two outboard motors.

programme.title: How to - Anchor with Raymarine
programme.desc: Welcome to another appointment with "How to". In this episode Bacci Del Buono explains how to correctly set the alarm for anchoring.

programme.title: It all begins with a dream
programme.desc: Selva Marine is an Italian company located in the middle of the Alps, in Valtellina.It all began when, one Sunday in the 1950s, the Selva family decided to go to Milan for the powerboat race. For Lorenzo Selva it was the beginning of a dream that he would soon turn into reality.

programme.title: Greenline 39 Hybrid - Annapolis Boat Show
programme.desc: Back in 2008, Greenline pioneered hybrid technology and today they present you with the new Greenline 39 Hybrid, seen at the Annapolis Boat Show 2022.

programme.title: Dockmate (Eng)
programme.desc: Bacci Del Buono takes you to discover Dockmate, a real pocket helm station that ensures quick and easy mooring.

programme.title: Monaco Energy Boat Challenge - 2023

programme.title: MJM – Factory Tour
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is inside the MJM Boats shipyard for an exclusive tour to discover the production process, design and technology that make MJM one of the most authoritative names in motor boating.

programme.desc: Join The Full Nerd gang as they talk about the latest PC hardware topics.

programme.title: How to make your iPhone ‘Aesthetic’ with iOS 14
programme.desc: By using Shortcuts together with custom Widgets and the App Library, you can build a totally unique home screen look. In this video Jason walks us through the steps on how to set it all up.

programme.title: Should you re-paste a laptop CPU? Is liquid metal better? | Ask a PC expert - Part 4
programme.desc: In part 4 of this six-part series, we focus on the benefits of re-pasting a laptop CPU and whether or not liquid metal is worth it.

programme.title: Jumper on CA RT 99 with Eng 13
programme.desc: Firefighter Keola Park who youve see on Engine 3, is now part of the water rescue and USAR teams. He starts his day before his shift with a boot in his hand on a busy corner as part of the "Fill the Boot for Jerrys Kids" drive. 1st call, a gas leak, then off to water rescue training with the team at the pool. Then they all meet at the river with fast moving currents, for Keola, this is his first time. Afternoon shopping for the next 48 hours, and back to the station for a sit down lunch. Night, a call comes in, a man is standing on a giant road sign attached to the crossing bridge high above the California 99 Highway, and hes cutting his wrists, the road is closed in both ways and hes got an audience.

programme.title: Eric Clapton & Steve Winwood - Live from Madison Square Garden
programme.desc: History rocked and rock made history during a sold-out three-gig stand at Madison Square Garden in late February 2008 when icons Eric Clapton and Steve Winwood performed a concert together for the first time since their all-too-brief days in the legendary Blind Faith in 1969. Whether they will ever team again is unknown. But with Eric Clapton and Steve Winwood Live From Madison Square Garden fans everywhere are able to experience the sound and the glory of a performance on that famous stage by two of rock's greatest artists.

programme.title: Ed Sheeran - Live in London
programme.desc: Ed Sheeran manages to make a huge venue feel like an intimate setting. With only his guitar and his incredible vocal skills, Ed puts on a great performance in 2014 at the Roundhouse Art Centre, in London.

programme.title: Milky Chance - Garorock Festival 2017
programme.desc: The German duet is back and better than ever! Milky Chance is the success story of two school friends, Clemens Rehbein and Philipp Dausch. After a long break, 2017 marks the release of a second, long-waited, album "Blossom". And, for the public, finally the occasion to discover live these new compositions, mixing rock, folk and electro pop. With reggae vibrations that can rub shoulders with house elements, Milky Chance has one of the most singular sounds. With the presence of musicians on stage, and if we believe the listening of the new record, we can expect more electric concerts, more electronic and even more energetic than in the past!

programme.title: Tumalog & Aguinid Falls: Philippines
programme.desc: Start your journey marveling at the cascading turquoise waters of Tumalog Falls, nestled amidst the lush forest and tropical foliage, and stay captivatingly thrilled by Aguinid Falls' multi-tiered rapids and unique rock formations.

programme.title: Jan Latham-Koenig, Symfonieorkest Vlaanderen & Pascal Amoyel - Grieg's Piano Concerto & Beethoven Symphony No. 7
programme.desc: Conductor Jan Latham-Koenig leads the Flanders Symphony Orchestra in this concert recorded at Concertgebouw Brugge, Belgium, on April 21, 2016. The program opens with Felix Mendelssohn’s concert overture Die Hebriden, Op. 26 (The Hebrides). During a trip to Scotland, the composer was deeply impressed by the natural splendor of Staffa, an island of the Inner Hebrides, which inspired him to compose his concert overture. Next on the program is Edvard Grieg’s Piano Concerto in A minor, Op. 16, featuring Pascal Amoyel as the pianist. It is the composer’s only concerto. Grieg composed the work in 1868, drawing inspiration from Norwegian folk music. The program ends with Ludwig van Beethoven’s Symphony No. 7 in A major, Op. 92. The work is very popular, especially because of its touching second movement. At the Allegretto’s 1813 premiere, the audience demanded an immediate encore.

programme.title: Leonardo García Alarcón, Cappella Mediterranea & Mariana Flores - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: David Grimal & Les Dissonances - Beethoven - Symphony No. 5 in C minor, Op. 67
programme.desc: Les Dissonances is a collective of artists founded by violinist David Grimal in 2004. The conductorless ensemble consists of musicians from the most prestigious European orchestras, international soloists, and young talents. In this performance, Les Dissonances perform Ludwig van Beethoven’s Symphony No. 5 in C minor, Op. 67. Beethoven composed Symphony No. 5 between 1804 and 1808, completing the work at nearly the same time as his Symphony No. 6, ‘Pastorale’. Both symphonies premiered as part of an all-Beethoven program at the same concert on December 22, 1808. Symphony No. 5 has become one of the best-known compositions in classical music. It opens with the famous four-note motif, often interpreted as the musical manifestation of ’fate knocking at the door’. This rhythmic figure returns in various guises in the other three movements of the symphony. The second movement consists of a set of lyrical variations on two themes. The third movement begins gently, but leads to a blasting horn section presenting a theme that features the rhythmic pattern of the four-note motif. The movement leads uninterrupted to the fourth movement that features a triumphant finale ending in C major. This performance was recorded at Philharmonie de Paris, France, in 2015.

programme.title: Matthias Goerne - Classica Spotlight
programme.desc: Cinematic classical clips and energizing concert pieces featuring up-and-coming artists.

programme.title: Philippe Herreweghe, Collegium Vocale Gent, Dorothee Mields & Thomas Hobbs - J. S. Bach - Chamber music
programme.desc: Philippe Herreweghe conducts his Collegium Vocale Gent in this chamber music program dedicated to the music of J. S. Bach. On the program are Bach’s Orchestral Suite No. 4 in D major, BWV 1069; Gott der Herr ist Sonn und Schild, BWV 79; and Missa brevis in G major, BWV 236. The soloists are soprano Dorothee Mields, tenor Thomas Hobbs, countertenor Alex Potter, and bass Peter Kooij. The program continues with a fine selection of Bach’s works performed by French lutenist Thomas Dunford. On the program are Suite for lute in G minor, BWV 995; Suite for solo cello in G major (arr. for lute), BWV 1007; and Chaconne from Partita for solo violin in D minor (arr. lute), BWV 1004. This concert was recorded at Concertgebouw Brugge, Belgium, in 2017.

programme.title: Philippe Herreweghe, Collegium Vocale Gent, Dorothee Mields & Thomas Hobbs - J. S. Bach - Chamber music
programme.desc: Philippe Herreweghe conducts his Collegium Vocale Gent in this chamber music program dedicated to the music of J. S. Bach. programme.title: Errol Garner - Erroll Garner - Live in Singer Concertzaal, Laren
programme.desc: On June 18, 1962, American pianist and composer Erroll Garner performed at the Singer Concertzaal in Laren. The vibrant and joyous concert was played with drummer Kelly Martin and bassist Eddie Calhoun, each long-standing collaborators from Garner's trio. The Singer Concertzaal in Laren, the Netherlands is a concert hall and museum dedicated to the preservation of the art collection of American William Henry Singer. It features a variety of artists, both visual and aural.

programme.title: Christian McBride - Christian McBride - John Day
programme.desc: On July 20, 2018, double bassist Christian McBride presented his band ‘New Jawn’ at the Malta Jazz Festival. A five-time Grammy winner, McBride is one of the most requested, most recorded, and most respected figures in the music world today. Hailing from Philadelphia, this music luminary combines jazz, R&B, pop/rock, hip hop/neo-soul, and classical. Gracing the Malta Jazz stage with him are Nasheet Waits (drums), Marcus Strickland (tenor sax), and Josh Evans (trumpet).

programme.title: Charlie Parker - The Story of Jazz
programme.desc: The documentary The Story of Jazz is a seamless array of performances, commentary, and compelling historic insights about jazz, zooming in on the cross-cultural influences that produced this constantly evolving and enduring music. Many call jazz the greatest art form of the 20th century. This absorbing weave of sounds, rare film clips, stills and interviews shows how this truly American expression spread to become a universal, musical language, from the New Orleans traditions, stride, swing, boogie woogie, big band, jump band, blues, bebop, Afro-Cuban, cool, and free-form, to jazz vocalists and dancers… Never before have the filmed comments of so many important great jazz artists been assembled for one project, and never before has the history of jazz been told as vividly and with such attention to historic detail.

programme.title: Thelonious Monk - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Billie Holiday - Billie Holiday
programme.desc: “God Bless The Child”, “Foolin’ Myself”, and “I Loves You, Porgy”: timeless songs that were made classics by the inimitable Billie Holiday. ‘Lady Day’, as her loyal friend and musical partner Lester Young nicknamed her, was a highly original jazz and pop singer. In a career that spanned most of the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s, she displayed an uncanny ability to convey emotion through her voice. Her vocals, which were strongly inspired by instrumental jazz, are admired for their deeply personal and intimate sound. This compilation features recordings from the 1950s of Billie Holiday singing a string of her greatest successes. Enjoy this unique footage of one of jazz’s all-time greats!

programme.title: Coleman Hawkins - DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Robert Glasper & Jason Moran - La Gaité Lyrique: Robert Glasper & Jason Moran
programme.desc: As part of the Blue Note Jazz Festival and Blue Note Records’ 75th anniversary, pianists Robert Glasper and Jason Moran delivered a stunning jazz piano duet, resulting in an exciting exploration of the great history of jazz. An intricate knowledge of African-American music is infused with modern energy. The two musicians reinterpret the stride piano tradition through captivating original songs and personal interpretations of the music of Albert Ammons, Andrew Hill, Thelonious Monk, Ornette Coleman and Herbie Hancock.

programme.title: Not Another Black Movie
programme.desc:
Not Another Black Movie stars Damon Williams (Bad Boys of Comedy, Comic View, BET LIVE, The Tom Joyner Morning Show), Janet Hubert (The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air), Rodney Perry (The Monique Show, Who's Got Jokes) Jay Davis (Not Another Zombie Movie, Shots Fired), and Leon Rogers (WGCI, Comic View, Bad Boys of Comedy).
Not Another Black Movie is not only a spoof of a genre often associated with Tyler Perry films, but a satirical look at family dysfunction as well. Written by Jay Davis and Directed by Donte "Diesel" Williams, Not Another Black Movie addresses issues that effect many families whether they be rich or poor, black or white. Although we poke fun at some of the stereotypical roles portrayed in this genre, we hope to shed some light on problems that plague many families while giving you a good laugh.

programme.title: UFA 344 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 8 - Wassmer vs. Lua
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 8 from Southern California. In this episode, Kester Abad faces Dylan Stockard in a flyweight bout and Daniel Labastida and Matheus Santos face off in a bantamweight contest. Also watch as David Babakhanyan takes on Daniel Gualajara and in the main event, Elwig Wassmer, defending title holder and a biochemist looks to take on Israel Lua (Ben Jones camp) with knockout power, in whats expected to be a combustible fight with two titles on the line. The fighters contend for both the UNF flyweight title and the California state championship title.

programme.title: "UFA 348 - CFC 13 Non Ducor, Duco"
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Centurion Fighting Championship 13, Non Ducor Duco from Sao Paulo Brazil. This episode features a four man tournament. In the first match of the night Fabrico Martins faces Bruno Tavares and in the second match Leandro Rodrigues faces Antonio Monteiro. The two winners will move on to the main event.

programme.title: UFA 345-346 - Bare Knuckle Boxing 33
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 33 Part 1 from London. In this episode, Sean McPike faces Ash Williams in a battle between Birmingham and Wales. Nathan Decastro takes on Tony Shields, Luke Smith gets in the ring with Corey Healey, Liam Rees fights Joe Fitzpatrick in a flyweight title clash and Bradley Scott current cruiser weight champion faces the challenger Kevin Greenwood for the title. United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 33 Part 1 from London part 2. Starting off this episode, Irelands Jonny Lawson battles Brightons Sonny Smith in the Prize Fighter semi-final bout and Aaron Sinclair and Scott McHugh matchup for the second semi-final bout where the winning fighters will head to Thailand for the final match. Dan Lerwell takes on C.J. Mills in the World Middle Weight Title clash and in the main event Jimmy Sweeney takes on Ionel Levitchi.

programme.title: UFA 342-343 - Bare Knuckle Boxing 32
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 32 part 1 from London. In the flyweight devision, Salim Jamshidi and Joe Fitzpatrick, both making their pro BKB debut, battle for the win. Stanlee Wilson faces Tony Barratt, Reece Murray takes on the much more experienced Jonny Lawson, Danny Meins goes head to head with Tony Meeham and Martyn Grainger faces Eryk Majda in the Cruiserweight division. United Fight Alliance presents Bare Knuckle Boxing 32 part 2 from London. Steven Evans takes on Matty Moore in a Wales versus Ireland fight in the middleweight division. Beau Besley faces Michael Devine in a featherweight clash, Lawrence Tracey and Kevin Greenwood match up in a light-heavyweight bout, Scott McHugh takes on Aaron McCallum in a British Bantamweight title fight. In the main event Jimmy Sweeney takes on Kearon Thomas in the lightweight division.

programme.title: Shanghai Me - A taste of 1930's China
programme.desc: A favourite for Royalty, celebrities and sports stars, Shanghai Me transports its guests back in time to pre-war China. Taste finds out why this fine-dining restaurant has been voted one of the best in the gulf region. Shanghai in the 1930s was called the Paris of the East. One restaurant that’s capturing that flavour is Shanghai Me in Dubai’s financial district. Exuding the atmosphere the Orient, this establishment offers a unique dining experience. Euronews Evan Bourke paid a visit to meet Head Chef Shane Macneill, who cooked one of the restaurants signature dishes, black cod. Click on the video link above to watch the full episode.

programme.title: Adventurous East London
programme.desc: Jewelry Designer Mira Ovaskainen tells us where to go and things to do in East London.

programme.title: Where To Indulge in Chicago
programme.desc: Think Chicago is just deep-dish pizza and hot dogs? Lifestyle expert & Chicago native Bahar Takhtechian shares her favorite Chicago restaurants.

programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Getaway to Bahamas' Green Turtle Cay
programme.desc: Green Turtle Cay in the Bahamas is a quick plane flight from Florida. The three-mile wide island is located in the Abaco Out Islands. Take a video tour of the islands charming diversions.

programme.title: Adventurous East London Locations
programme.desc: Mira Ovaskainen of VALO shares the Top Spots to visit in the Coolest East London Neighborhoods. Watch now & get adventurous on your London trip!

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Why visitors are hooked on Dubai Marina, home to luxury yachts, docks, hotels and beach clubs
programme.desc: Whether you see it from the deck of a boat or the wire of its 1km zipline, Dubai Marina is a spectacle of ground-breaking architecture, bespoke superyachts and luxury shoreline hospitality. This sought-after holiday destination encompasses the coastal neighbourhood of Jumeirah Beach Residence, known locally as JBR, home to retail and entertainment developments The Walk and The Beach, which multiple the attractions for fun-seekers. Iconic five-star hotels hug the shoreline, their vast marble lobbies leading to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunches and postcard-perfect beaches. Le Méridien Mina Seyahi Beach Resort & Marina is one of the longest-standing hotels in Dubai Marina with 500 metres of private Arabian Gulf coastline providing a playground for water sports enthusiasts. Local expats regularly fill the resort’s Barasti bar, restaurant and beach club. A Dubai institution in its second decade, this well-liked venue has grown into a sprawling sports and beach bar with open-air screenings and food stalls, and the only free-entry beach club in town. Despite progression, Barasti retains its original theme, defined by palm fronds typically found in the traditional barasti shelters favoured by the early Bedouins. Other Dubai Marina beach clubs that draw crowds include Drift to Zero Gravity . Drift is dizzyingly beautiful; its pool deck, a catwalk for the latest swimwear fashions. Open until late, Zero Gravity is known for its high-octane parties and voyeuristic glass-sided pool. Sun worshippers on Dubai Marina’s deep sandy beaches pose for photos that frame its remarkable urban skyline. It’s a backdrop that’s hard to miss, containing some of the tallest residential towers in the world. The 101-storey Princess Tower once claimed the title of the highest, while the Cayan Tower retains its record for the world’s tallest building with a 90-degree twist; it’s structure akin to a giant corkscrew. Flying through the skyscrapers on XLine Dubai is an exhilarating way to experience this brave a

programme.title: Sak Yant Tattoo
programme.desc: Traditional hand needle tattoos have been a staple of Thai culture for centuries with the common practitioners being Buddhist monks. Why? The spiritual significance and meanings behind the permanent body art are manifestations of the individual’s aura. Ajarn Noo, a former Buddhist monk turned spiritual Thai tattoo master, has gained international recognition since tattooing Angelina Jolie and consequently many other celebrities like Michele Rodriguez and David Beckham. His tattoo parlor is unlike any you’ve ever been to because he performs the spiritual practice in the sanctuary of his own home. Walk past the larger than life statues devoted to Buddha, up the stairs and into the top floor of his residence There you will find photos adorning his walls of countless celebrities, the royal family and others who have come before you. You can than evaluate your various options but here is the kicker – there is no guarantee you will get the tattoo you are looking for. You must first stand before Ajarn Noo for a spiritual evaluation and based on each individual’s aura, Ajarn Noo will either approve and customize a tattoo for you based on your own spirit or send you packing. So come with a clear heart, a clear mind and let your inner soul speak to Ajarn in hopes of a tattoo blessing that will be unlike any other.

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

programme.title: Taipei
programme.desc: Being underestimated, is one of the biggest advantages. Maybe that’s what makes Taipei a unique city and one of Asia’s best kept secrets when it comes to food, fun, and all things lifestyle. Often under-reported and overlooked, Taiwan’s global impact for such a small island is breathtaking. When it comes to Taiwan and food, experts and enthusiasts alike know that they go hand-in-hand. It is no wonder Taipei is overflowing with electricity as new ideas and re-imagined classics are popping up all over town. This magical friction is a big reason Taipei’s food scene is attracting young talent from the world’s best kitchens looking to experiment, innovate, and test their ideas against the discerning palates of the local crowds. Highlighted by some of the world’s best produce, great transportation, magnificent hiking trails 5 minutes from downtown, a vibrant nightlife, and an openness towards travelers and new faces makes Taipei one of Black Buddha’s favorite cities.

programme.title: Vegetarian in NYC's East Village

programme.title: Why day-trippers and holidaymakers are hooked on Dubai Marina
programme.desc: The glories of Dubai Marina Dubai Marina is much more than just a glamorous urban dock for luxury yachts (although its that as well!) Its also home to a huge range of chic bars and restaurants to suit all tastes and moods. And, of course, it has those iconic towers that define its famous skyline. One of the best ways to admire the architecture around Dubai Marina is from the deck of a boat. You can charter a private yacht, hop onboard an organised boat tour - or you can even cross the marina for as little as €2 in a water taxi. Five-star resorts hug the coastline. Their vast, marble-clad lobbies lead to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunch venues and postcard-perfect beaches. As for Dubai Marinas beach clubs, from Drift to Zero Gravity , they are dizzyingly beautiful; their pool decks are catwalks for the latest swimwear fashions. Jumereirah Beach Residence Jumeirah Beach Residence itself is the largest single-phase commercial and residential project in the world. Its strategically lined along a chic waterfront strip known as The Walk , feautring stunning 3D murals. The Walk has a very varied range of fashion, home and handicraft shops and boutiques. The outdoor pop-up market stalls offer jewellery, food treats and homeware, as well as performances by street entertainers. Jumereirah Beach Residence is made up of 40 high-rise buildings divided into six clusters, all with superb access to first-class retailers, entertainment venues and restaurants. Up on the Flying Cup The adjacent cosmopolitan shopping area The Beach has many attractions, including the floating adventure park Aqua Fun . This amazing water park makes a statement, by spelling out "I ♡ Dubai" via is pools and slides when seen from above. Another highlight at The Beach is The Flying Cup , a ride that you can sit in and be elevated to fabulous views, seen in all their glory from 40 metres up - while eating and drinking! From the top, you can see Ain Dubai, Palm Jumeirah and, of course, that wonderful Duba

programme.title: Hong Kong
programme.desc: From the simple perfection of summer boating, to the daily eruption of energy that is Lan Kwai Fong, Hong Kong has you covered an all things food, drink, entertainment, and lifestyle. The enchanting neighborhoods are coiled with history and culture, each with its own timeline of stories that speak persuasively about Hong Kong’s modernization. Situated against the backdrop of its secret cove-like harbor, the architecture that graces the land is just as extreme. Hong Kong sits atop the throne as the city with the most skyscrapers in the world, yet the urbanized areas are only a fraction of the city itself. The nature that surrounds and pushes through the city, gives Hong Kong it’s true indescribable magic. Denizens know where to find the hiking trails, the views, and escape routes to the open sea. The endless culinary delights, bold experiences, and hidden treasures make Hong Kong a torchbearer of culture, innovation, and lifestyle in Asia.

programme.title: How to Crack a Coconut (the Barbados Way)

programme.title: Flying on water - James O'Hagan tries out the latest addition to the surfing family
programme.desc: It looks like a surfboard, it moves like a surfboard, but its not a surfboard. Its an electric hydrofoil or E-foil. I visited Dubai Marine to have a go at E-foiling myself and find out what makes the activity so thrilling. The man putting me through my paces was Daniel van Dooren, the manager of Ibiza Foils and co-founder of Surf House Dubai . "The thing that makes it different is this hydrofoil wing on the bottom," explained Daniel. "Its got an aeroplane design, which basically lifts you out of the water and gives you that sensation like you’re flying." The E-foils are powered by an electric propeller and controlled remotely via Bluetooth. They can reach speeds of up to 45km an hour. Find out how I got on with my first experience on an E-foil by watching the video above this article. Heres a clue: I wont be giving up my day job anytime soon.

programme.title: The Mystical town of San Sebastian del Oeste, Mexio
programme.desc: Teri travels to San Sebastian del Oeste, an hour outside of Puerto Vallarta to experience the old mining town covered with pine, coffee and avocado trees. Here she learns the origin of the avocado, called aguacate (in Spanish) that was taken from the Nahuatl word of Āhuacatl (native Aztec language) which means "testicle tree".

programme.title: Off the beaten track, Orlando
programme.desc: Out of the many adventures one can have in Orlando, I choose the off the beaten path things to do. My journey begins at the Orlando World Center Marriott, home to the biggest most amazing pool I’ve ever seen. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that mermaid classes are offered through the Mermaid Academy, poolside. The real adventure begins at the Paddling Center at Shingle Creek, which is a quick drive from the hotel. Lined with Cypress trees and the beautiful sounds of nature, it was the perfect setting for a relaxing kayak experience. I end my time in Orlando shopping at Artegon Marketplace. This is mall filled with local artisans who are passionate about their work and products. My highlight was being able to ride on a cute stuffed mechanical animal as I peruse the shops.

programme.title: Adventures in St. Croix
programme.desc: Teri seeks adventure in St. Croix as she goes on horseback on the beach at Cane Bay, swims with the horses, and learns secrets from a local Bush Doctor in Caldonia National Park.

programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: Find out why medical tourism is big business in Dubai
programme.desc: Medical tourism is a booming global industry, estimates on market size vary but the Patients Without Borders publishing group puts its value at around €60 to €80 billion worldwide, each year, with 20 to 24 million patients travelling for medical treatments annually. Around the world, aging populations, rising healthcare costs, and pressures on the insurance industry have created opportunities for destinations like Dubai , that have been able to invest rapidly in their healthcare infrastructure and capitalise on the sharp increase in demand for health tourism. Encouraging international institutions Dr Marwan Mohamed Al Mulla, CEO, Health Regulation Sector, Dubai Health Authority said, “Recently a new law has come into effect which encourages and allows international institutions to have their own, 100 percent ownership The Dubai Health Authority has had a medical tourism strategy in place since 2014 with the aim of developing and supporting its healthcare sector and steadily increasing its contribution towards Dubais gross domestic product. Focusing on an inbound patient’s airport-to-airport needs has helped providers capitalise too. Dr Basel Nasrallah, Medical Director, Armada said, “We in our facility, for example, get about 5 percent more patients from abroad. Patients are coming from all around the world. We are receiving patients from Russia, mainly Europe, Italy, Spain, UK, and North America from Africa, from South Asia Why have health checks in Dubai? Interestingly, many of those countries are known for the strength of their own medical tourism offerings, but Dubai is still an attractive option for patients who are looking to combine their treatments with other pursuits. Alexander Edwards, Surgical Patient, from the UK said, “Well there were multiple aspects I looked at prior to coming obviously looking at the time it takes, for the recovery period. I had all the research done before I came and found some fantastic reviews, very positive feedback from other friends and family that

programme.title: From screen to plate: the MasterChef restaurant goes live
programme.desc: Its the most successful cookery television format in the world having been adapted in 52 countries and viewed by over 250 million people worldwide. Now the MasterChef TV Experience is going from screen to plate with a new restaurant in Dubai. Its a world first, and Euronews Jane Witherspoon went to check it out. Shaun O’Neale was champion of MasterChef US Season 7 . He says the contest was one of the most stressful and hardest things hes ever done. "Youve got Gordon Ramsay screaming down your throat if youre not doing something right. But, it was the most rewarding thing, the most fulfilling thing. It really showed me my true passion and my true love for food. So its about time for people to come in and experience and get a taste of that mystery box." Now Sean and other MasterChef champions will be in residency at the MasterChef TV Experience - where they will also compose their own personal menus. Running the show In charge of the kitchen, the restaurants Head Chef, Margarita Vaamonde-Beggs. She says the MasterChef brand is a perfect fit for a restaurant - and for Dubai. "I believe that we stand out for us because we have already a huge fan base. In the Dubai market, it’s a city of foodies and it means something to so many people around the world." The Mystery Box One highlight on the menu is based on the shows Mystery Box challenge. Guests choose secret ingredients from the box and chefs have 35 minutes to create an original dish. And thats the dish Euronews wants. Today the Mystery Box ingredients include black garlic, Jerusalem artichokes, fresh oregano and a variety of mushrooms. They look delicious but will barely more than half-an-hour be enough time to turn them into a meal? Chef Margarita isnt worried: "We are going to be on time. Its going to be fine." It gets down to wire but 35 minutes later, with not a second to spare, Chef Margarita has produced a mouth-watering stuffed raviolo, covered with chocolate and black garlic. Not only does it taste amazing,

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

programme.title: The Story of the Zhonghe Animal Shelter
programme.desc: The Story of the Zhonghe Animal Shelter In Taiwan, the issue of homeless animals has been a cause for concern for many years, and even in the capital city of Taipei, stray dogs and cats are a common sight. Taiwan saw a rise in abandoned animals during the 1980’s, during a time of economic growth. Residents who were uninformed of the responsibilities that comes with raising a pet, eventually abandoned said animals on the streets. Today, we have invited Godfrey Gao, a Taiwanese-Canadian actor, model and humanitarian, to interview the Director of the Animal Epidemic Prevention Center. The setting is at the Zhonghe Animal Shelter, a place that has truly become a haven for stray dogs in recent years.Operating under the government of New Taipei City, Zhonghe Animal Shelter seeks to provide unwanted dogs with the safest and best care they can afford. Upon entering their care, every animal will be given vaccination, a health screening, de-worming, microchip implantation, and are spayed or neutered. Depending on their gender, male dogs will receive a mark on the left ear, while females are marked on the right ear. Once the process is finished, these dogs are ready for adoption.While there are other breeds at the animal shelter, their stay is never long since they get adopted rather swiftly, leaving the shelter with a 90 majority of the Formosan Mountain Dog, or more simply known as, Taiwanese Dog. The characteristics of the Taiwanese dog breed include a triangular face, agile feet that are known for their hopping skill, and a sickle tail. The personality of the Formosan is loyal, intelligent, affectionate and understanding. “These dogs are suited for being hunting or search dogs, so the current feeding rate for these dogs is quite high. We mainly have black ones, but we also have brown and yellow ones,” says the Director.Currently, most, if not all the dogs at the Shelter have been desexed. This ‘zero-kill’ plan started on the 1st of March last year, under the guidance of the mayor of New Taipei City, Zhu Li Luen. Howeve

programme.title: American MC : Biker Boot Camp
programme.desc: For more than a decade, Tommy Baker has led a group of week-end bikers on rides literally all across America. Along the way, he decided they should call themselves "The Ice Cream Men From Hell." He designed a patch and gave the colors to the riders he thought were worthy. They werent an official Motorcycle Club, but maybe - one day - theyll try. That day has finally arrived. Baker put together the quintessential biker journey - a biker boot camp - to see if he and his buddies had what it takes to be a real Motorcycle Club - an M.C. - an American M.C. Getting seventeen men, from all walks of life and three states together is the first mission - and it doesnt go smoothly. Once they do all meet up and start riding together one of them goes down five minutes in.

programme.title: JC Penney CEO Marvin Ellison Takes Retail Giant into the Digital Age
programme.desc: This week, we spotlight J.C. Penney Company Chairman and CEO Marvin Ellison, who shares his strategy to bring the brick-and-mortar retail store into the digital age. Then, former radio personality Egypt Sherrod, who successfully shifted careers into the more lucrative real estate business. Later, Chief Marketing Officer for Nationwide, Terrance Williams, shares his vision for the insurance giant. And finally, we turn our attention to Gideon’s Promise, an organization dedicated to protecting the underserve caught in the grips of the criminal justice system.

programme.title: Why You Need a Career Coach
programme.desc: Angelina Darrisaw, Founder of C-Suite Coach, shares how career coaching can help Black women overcome isolation and anxiety at work

programme.title: Mobilizing Black Healthcare Professionals
programme.desc: One of the most important keys to addressing negative health outcomes that disproportionately impact Black people is the growth and advancement of more Black healthcare professionals who understand the needs, lifestyles, and cultures of Black communities. In 2019, Duclas Charles founded Black Health Connect with a mission “to create and curate a digital and physical hub for Black healthcare professionals.” Charles joins Beyond The Hype to talk about the goals and impact of Black Health Connect, the upcoming BHC Con 2025 in Washington, DC, and the importance of prioritizing Black representation in health and wellness professions.

programme.title: Leveraging Supplier Diversity to Grow Black Wealth
programme.desc: Entrepreneurship is a key pathway to wealth creation, and the capacity to do business as a supplier of goods and services to global corporations is a proven strategy to transition from small start-up to emerging growth company. ManuLife John Hancock Chief Procurement Officer Guarav Saini joins Beyond The Hype to share how partnering with diverse suppliers to power corporate performance can also drive Black wealth creation through entrepreneurship.

programme.title: It's the Tony Awards Season with Kenny Leon
programme.desc: We salute excellence in Broadway theater with a look at some of the past Tony Award winners and nominees who appeared on our show. We profile Director Kenny Leon, who received a nominations for Best Director in “A Raisin in the Sun.” Plus, we remember Nicole Ari Parker and Blair Underwood who appeared on Broadway in “A Streetcar Named Desire.” Then, we look back at David Alan Grier, who played a mean villan in “Porgy & Bess.” And finally, Alicia Keys discovered how sticky being a Broadway producer can be when was the force behind “Stick Fly.”

programme.title: Feeling Burned Out?
programme.desc: Rest is a form of resistance. Learn how to spot – and reverse – the signs of burnout from Hooky Wellness founder Erayna Sargent.

programme.title: Finding Your Fortune In Fintech: Opportunities in the Tech and Finance Industries
programme.desc: How do we ensure that the best among us are assured the opportunities they deserve in two of the hottest and highest paying industries in corporate America: technology and financial services, not to mention a market driver for both: financial technology or fintech? Join our panel of high-level corporate HR and diversity specialists for a frank, forward-looking discussion of collaborative, intentional, and results-oriented strategies to push black excellence through the executive opportunity pipeline.

programme.title: Eyes On | What We Know About the Mid Air Collision
programme.desc: Today we are joined by Dr. Randolph Mahoney, a retired widebody Captain for a major US airline, having recently completed 37 years of service. He is also a former Naval Aviator, Naval Aviation Safety Officer, and Naval Flight Instructor. In both his civilian and military roles, he has participated in mishap investigations, and helped develop safety and training programs. He holds FAA certificates as an Airline Transport Pilot, and also has commercial pilot privileges in aircraft and helicopters, as well as being a Certified Flight Instructor and Advanced Ground Instructor. Having flown extensively in the National Capital Area, he is very familiar with Reagan National Airport and operations there.

programme.title: Covert Cabal
programme.desc: Dive deep into the details of military technology from around the world.

programme.title: Ward CarrollTV Showcase
programme.desc: Ward talks aviation and current events.

programme.title: Team House | SEAL Team 6 Operator Trey Lindsey
programme.desc: A 20-year Navy veteran, Trey Lindsey served 18 years as a Navy SEAL, including 13 with SEAL Team 6, undertaking numerous combat deployments. He's now the CEO of Gallowglass Guardian Group, providing tactical and security consulting for law enforcement, military, and civilians. Trey is also a Louisiana POST certified and NTOA instructor.

programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief

Their daily conversations with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond cover the latest in business, investment, and geopolitics. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day.

Bloomberg Originals
programme.desc: Bloomberg Originals offers bold takes for curious minds on today’s biggest topics. Covering stories you haven’t seen and viewpoints you haven’t heard, you’ll discover cinematic, data-led documentaries that investigate the intersection of business and culture. Exploring every angle of climate change, technology, finance, sports and beyond, Bloomberg Originals is business as you’ve never seen it.

programme.title: National Bird
programme.desc: From executive producers Errol Morris and Wim Wenders, NATIONAL BIRD follows the dramatic journey of three whistleblowers who are determined to break the silence around one of the most controversial current affairs issues of our time — the secret US drone war. With rare insight into the program through the eyes of veterans and survivors, the film explores the complexities of drone warfare from a human perspective.

programme.title: Fiddlin
programme.desc: Sister filmmakers Julie Simone and Vicki Vlasic return to their Appalachian roots to document the worlds oldest fiddlers convention. With multiple generations jamming together, including a guitar god and his 11-year-old prodigy, FIDDLIN’ is a love letter to the uplifting healing power of music and a foot stomping celebration of artistic expression.

programme.title: Bee Nation
programme.desc: There’s one way to spell success, but many ways to define it. In Saskatchewan, Canada indigenous students are competing in the first ever province-wide First Nations Spelling Bee, an opportunity to compete against the nation’s best. BEE NATION highlights kids who have dedicated themselves to their education in an inspiring story that encourages us all to be our best selves.

programme.title: FishON! | Remote Escapes: Pike Frenzy and Hidden Lake Explorations
programme.desc: In the thrilling Season 7 finale, Paul & Perry and the team venture deep into Northern Ontario, using a Polaris Ranger to access a remote lake with high hopes for walleye. However, the day takes a surprising turn as Northern Pike steal the show with their spirited action. The adventure doesn’t end there—a bonus portage into another lake offers a chance to explore uncharted waters. It’s a fitting conclusion to a season filled with the unexpected and unforgettable.

We know her as America’s adored high school sweetheart, but now Tiffani Thiessen can add cookbook author to her roster that includes host, mom, wife and of course actress. Featuring 125 recipes, Pull Up a Chair: Recipes From My Family To Yours Opens a New Window. includes everything from cozy fall dinners to decadent desserts. Watch the Saved By the Bell alum make one of her family recipes from the book ­– her mom’s cream cheese pie ­– plus get a peek into her gorgeous kitchen in the video above!

programme.title: Forbidden Science - Digital Desire
programme.desc: Forbidden Science is a unique blend of noir science fiction and erotic programming. Set in the near future, the stories revolve around the evil corporation, 4Ever Innovations, whose young and brilliant scientists download and sell memories. They replace those we've lost with clones and devise technology that helps us live out our greatest fantasies; from saving a failed relationship, to creating the perfect lover, to being irresistible to the opposite sex - but sometimes our deepest desires come at a terrible price. 4Ever offers customers the opportunity to live out their fantasies in a virtual world but there are secrets within 4Ever Innovations that may cost you your life.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay’s Great Escape - India Part 2
programme.desc: In tonight’s second programme Gordon’s got a taste for adventure and heads off the tourist track into impenetrable north-east India, home of the country’s best-kept culinary secrets. Leaving the 21st century behind, he immerses himself in the life of a local meat-loving tribe in Nagaland, once better known for head-hunting than their curries. Then he’s off to Assam to enter a housewives’ competition to find the best Assamese dish; and finally he sets up shop among the street food stalls of Calcutta to try and tempt the local foodies into buying north-east curry – Ramsay style.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay’s Great Escape - India Part 3
programme.desc: In tonight’s final programme Gordon heads south to the coasts of Kerala for the ultimate seafood curry. In Tamil Nadu he hits a meat-free zone and faces his biggest culinary nightmare, living in an ashram where the only food on the menu is vegetarian. Any tranquillity soon evaporates when Gordon tries his highest-octane sport yet - bullock racing - before his final stop in the slums of Mumbai. There he cooks on Slumdog Millionaire streets before putting himself to the ultimate test, cooking alongside one of India's top chefs for a star-studded dinner at the Taj Hotel.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay’s Great Escape - Vietnam
programme.desc: Gordon touches down in Vietnam – he’s never been here before but this nation are fearless foodies; if it moves they eat it and every bit of it! On Gordon’s travels he is wowed by legendary local restaurateur Mrs Duck who turns out to be the queen of beak to tail cooking, he loses his bottle when a 6 foot long snake complete with beating heart is served-up for dinner and finishes his week trying to impress Vietnam’s pickiest foodies when he takes over a traditional restaurant and has his own Kitchen Nightmare.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay’s Great Escape - Cambodia
programme.desc: Gordon is going off the beaten track to Cambodia. After the years of Khmer Rouge rule and civil war the country was at year zero. Today the country is in recovery and the food is undergoing a revival. Gordon scours the country hunting out historic recipes that pre-date the Khmer Rouge rule. He hires a chopper to take him into the heart of the jungle where he discovers a dessert fit for a restaurant, he turns hunter gatherer wading through snake infested rivers on the hunt for a Cambodian favourite, frog and is on the trail of Cambodia’s hairiest delicacy, tarantula!

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay’s Great Escape - Malaysia
programme.desc: Gordon is in Malaysia where he quickly learns it’s the women and not the chefs that rule the kitchens. Gordon’s week is spent under the wing of some of the country’s best female cooks. He’s invited to cook his first Malaysian curry for the Prime Minister, scales great heights to find the key ingredient to birds nest soup before he’s entered in to a cooking competition against the country’s cooking against some of the hottest female cooks.
